subject: Education
title: Intrinsic vs. Extrinsic Motivation: Carrots and Sticks
description: A short lesson to help you apply Intrinsic vs. Extrinsic Motivation: Carrots and Sticks.

hook.text: Pay children to read and they read more. Stop paying them and they read less than before you started. Rewards can kill

buildup.text: Extrinsic motivation (grades, rewards, prizes) gets behavior. Intrinsic motivation (curiosity, mastery, purpose)

discovery.text: Deci's research showed that external rewards for activities people already enjoy undermines their internal drive.

twist.text: Schools run almost entirely on extrinsic motivation: grades, tests, class rank. This may be destroying students' love

climax.text: The paradox of motivation: rewarding learning can make people hate learning. The best motivation comes from within.

punchline.text: Paying someone to love what they do is the fastest way to make them stop.

quiz.question: What happens when you add external rewards to intrinsically enjoyable activities?
options: Motivation often decreases when the reward is removed
